Sara was playing outside and she saw something weird. She went closer and asked, "What is that?" 
It was a trophy with a marking on it. "I wonder what the marking means," thought Sara. 
So, she asked her dad. "Oh, that marking stands for winning a special game," said Dad. 
"Can I have the trophy to show off to my friends?" asked Sara. 
"Sure, you can have it," replied Dad. 
So, Sara took the weird trophy home and

, the boy had a large bag in his hands. 
The old man quickly ran over to the spot and grabbed the bag. Inside was a razor! 
He looked at the boy and said sternly, "I told you I don't have anything available. Now why don't you behave yourself and go home?" The young boy realized his mistake and ran away.
The old man shook his head and thought to himself, 'It's important to be a good role model so that others will behave too'. He was glad he could prevent something bad from happening by setting a good example.

She remembered that the tutor did not like smelly things either. She hoped the card would not get smelly in the mail. She held it tight and away from the garbage truck. One day, Sally was playing in the park when she stumbled across a strange sack lying in the grass. Sally picked up the sack and shook it. Something inside made a hard noise. 
Curious, Sally asked, "What's in the sack?" 
A voice answered, "Food!"
Sally smiled and opened the sack eagerly. As the sack opened, she found lots of yummy food inside. Sally ate until her tummy couldn't take any more.

One day, three year old Joey was playing in the park when he saw someone who was wearing a uniform. He asked the person what they were doing, and they replied that they were going to perform.
Joey asked what sort of performance they had to do, and they told him it was an acrobatic performance. Joey was enthralled and asked if he could join.
The person said they would need him to wear a uniform. Joey was happy to get dressed in a flexible white uniform with his name stitched onto it.

near a lake and the piglet saw a strange costume floating on the surface of the water. The piglet wanted to get the costume, but the farmer was worried that the piglet might drown if he went further into the water. So, the farmer asked the piglet to be very careful and to reverse back from the lake.
The piglet followed the farmer's advice and carefully moved back to the shore. The farmer was so proud of the piglet and hugged him to show his appreciation. After the piglet got back to the shore he looked again at the costume. It was an incredible costume with multiple colors.

John and David followed the arrow and soon they reached a clearing. In the clearing, they saw a little cat stuck in a tree.
John said, "That cat needs to be rescued!"
David said, "Let's get it!"
They got a ladder and placed it against the tree. Then, David climbed up the ladder and rescued the cat.
The cat was so happy it purred. John said, "That was a good rescue!"
David nodded and said, "Yes, it was a very good rescue!" Then, they all smiled.

's parents with menacing looks.
Jeff's parents were scared, but they held up their spears and shouted. The monkeys did not move and it looked like they were going to attack. Jeff's parents held each other's hands and shouted for help. Suddenly, the monkeys stepped back and surrendered! 
Jeff was very surprised that the monkeys had done this. He asked his parents why they had surrendered, and they explained that they had shown courage and strength when they held their spears. Jeff grinned, feeling very proud of his parents. They continued on their adventure, full of funny and weird surprises along the way.
